image.altText: A blond woman taking a selfie outside with a bearded man next to her and two girls climbing on their back above them

items.synopsis: Influenza case numbers are soaring around the country, with young people and children the hardest hit. Some experts say it is time to make better of use of antivirals.

title.children: 'Simply too late' flu season is so bad this year some experts are calling for more antiviral use

image.altText: A woman reads.

items.synopsis: Adelaide theatre company ActNow Theatre is touring South Australian schools with interpretive anti-racism workshops drawing from personal experiences. And one school says it's having a dramatic impact on discrimination.

title.children: Theatre company director uses racism experiences to spread message of 'respect for everyone'

image.altText: An Indigenous AFL player for Port Adelaide bends down to grab the ball as a Collingwood player closes in behind him.

items.synopsis: Port Adelaide forward Willie Rioli receives racist messages online after his side's narrow two-point defeat to AFL premiership favourites Collingwood.

title.children: Port Adelaide forward Willie Rioli hit with racist online abuse after Collingwood game

image.altText: police and forensic officers at the secne of a shooting

items.synopsis: Two men are in a critical condition and a woman is seriously injured in the city's south-west after Sydney's latest public shooting.

title.children: Three people in hospital, two critical, after 'targeted' shooting at Greenacre in Sydney

image.altText: Marnus Labuschange puts on his gloves and carries his bat under his arm as he walks out to the middle

items.synopsis: Thanks to a fighting Marnus Labuschagne century — and more than a little help from the rain — Australia still holds out hope of rescuing a draw at Old Trafford, setting up yet another grandstand finish.

title.children: Labuschagne helps Australia rediscover its grit, setting up a final-day fight for the Ashes

image.altText: A woman in a green dress with a buzzcut looks back at the camera in the middle of a grassy field

items.synopsis: Some young feminists in China are rebelling against mainstream beauty standards by embracing buzz cuts and ditching make-up.

title.children: Why young women in China are ditching 'beauty duty'

image.altText: Arisa Trew upside down on a skateboard.

items.synopsis: Chloe Covell and Arisa Trew break records at the 2023 X Games in California.

title.children: Thirteen-year-old Aussie skating prodigies win gold at X Games

image.altText: A man on a stretcher is carried up the narrow bus steps

items.synopsis: On the front lines of Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine, soldiers are facing a brutal onslaught. It's up to a volunteer team of medics, the Hospitallers Battalion, to evacuate the wounded back to safety in a race against the clock.

title.children: If you're wounded in Ukraine's brutal war, Lidia and her high-tech bus are your best hope

image.altText: Margot Robbie in a scene from Barbie and Cillian Murphy in a scene from Oppenheimer.

items.synopsis: Two of the year's most anticipated movies came out this weekend. Early estimates from the US put Barbie ahead in the box office takings.

title.children: Early figures from 'Barbenheimer' weekend put Barbie ahead of Oppenheimer

image.altText: Unidentified AFL player holding the ball on a muddy playing field.

items.synopsis: The Triabunna Roos were smashing the Oatlands Tigers during the last game of the home and away season in Tasmania when the incident occurred.

title.children: Umpire 'abuse towards a player' forces country footy match to be abandoned

image.altText: A Melbourne AFL player reacts as he celebrates a goal.

items.synopsis: Melbourne hosts Adelaide at the MCG, while GWS makes it six straight wins with its defeat of the Gold Coast Suns in Canberra. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Demons meet Crows as Giants continue winning streak

image.altText: Iannotta

items.synopsis: Angela Iannotta scored Australia's first ever World Cup goal at the 1995 Women's World Cup in Sweden — but there's hardly any proof it happened at all.

title.children: She scored our first goal in Women's World Cup history — but we can't show you video of the moment

image.altText: Aerial photo of beach to the hinterland.

items.synopsis: A developer wants to build thousands of homes on the Sunshine Coast but the council says the proposed estate will clash with an emerging housing project nearby and is not a solution to the current housing crisis.

title.children: Sunshine Coast Council opposes housing estate, says it clashes with another and risks the environment

image.altText: Gina Rinehart and her father Lang Hancock

items.synopsis: Australia's richest woman Gina Rinehart is at the centre of a legal showdown between the descendants of WA's iron ore pioneers, Lang Hancock and Peter Wright, with billions of dollars potentially at stake.

title.children: Australia's wealthiest mining heiresses to battle over royalties and ownership of lucrative mines

image.altText: A protester holds a sign saying 'sacred land' at a Rio Tinto protest.

items.synopsis: Western Australia's planning authorities are fielding an average of 25 phone calls and 50 emails a day from landholders, confused over the state's new Aboriginal heritage laws.

title.children: Farmers 'paralysed with fear' and authorities flooded with calls over WA's new Aboriginal heritage laws

image.altText: Boxes of vapes stacked next to each other on display

items.synopsis: The South Australian government launches a $2 million advertising blitz to reduce the number of people taking up vaping and smoking, with a special focus on young people.

title.children: Vaping, smoking targeted in new campaigns released by the SA government

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

items.synopsis: A former Australian soldier tells the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide that no counselling was offered to staff at the base where a young man was killed during a training drill.

title.children: 'Sent back out to training': Former soldier alleges no counselling offered after fatal accident

image.altText: A car crashed into a traffic light.

items.synopsis: A man is reported for allegedly driving over the legal alcohol limit and crashing into an intersection in Adelaide's CBD. Meanwhile, police search for a driver connected to two hit-and-run crashes in the city's north.

title.children: Man who allegedly levelled Adelaide CBD traffic light reported for drink driving

image.altText: Melanesian women in traditional face paint smiling widely

items.synopsis: The Melanesian Arts and Culture Festival in Port Vila, Vanuatu, platforms the song, dance and stories of one of the world's most culturally and linguistically diverse regions.

title.children: Colourful festival returns to celebrate one of the world's most diverse regions

image.altText: Mayor of Doomadgee Jason Ned

items.synopsis: Tributes flow for the 47-year-old Doomadgee mayor who championed Indigenous rights in remote communities. Locals remember a man with "dreams and aspirations" who was "taken far too young".

title.children: Outback mourns sudden death of 'passionate', 'humble' Indigenous leader Jason Ned

image.altText: A man stands over an anvil with a hammer in hand, next to a sign that reads 'Your future needs you. Your past does not'.

items.synopsis: Forging knives like a blacksmith was always a dream for this man. After a career in the defence and police force, it has become his latest way to serve others.

title.children: Forging helped Dean with his PTSD. Now he is helping other veterans heal through blacksmithing

image.altText: Tourists walk along a stony road in Rhodes as the sky behind them is filled with wildfire smoke

items.synopsis: Coastguard vessels and private boats evacuate thousands of people, including tourists, from beaches on the south-eastern part of the island, with people in nearby villages also warned to leave as flames approached.

title.children: Wildfire on Greek island of Rhodes forces mass evacuations, as tourists attempt to leave

image.altText: Four retro video games cases

items.synopsis: Unable to part with your old video games because of nostalgia? Staff at the National Film and Sound Archive know the feeling. In fact, they want to keep them for hundreds of years.

title.children: Why are staff at one of Australia's national institutions playing video games on the job?

image.altText: Hun Manet, son of Cambodia's Prime Minister Hun Sen, speaks during the final CPP election campaign.

items.synopsis: Hun Sen has been Cambodia's autocratic prime minister for nearly four decades. Now, he says he is ready to hand the premiership to his eldest son.

title.children: Cambodian leader's son set to take reins of power — but will he bring change?

image.altText: A great white shark looking at the camera almost looking like its smiling with its mouth open.

items.synopsis: Did you know South Australia is home to the only great white shark cage-diving tour in Australia? It's been around since the 1970s, but some locals aren't a fan.

title.children: Ever thought about cage-diving with great white sharks? Some people want you to think twice

image.altText: A young woman and an older man look at a dummy on a hospital bed.

items.synopsis: Children are taking part in a program designed to reduce their risk of ending up in WA's largest critical care facility.

title.children: ICU doctor Tim's daughter joined him at work. What she saw will change her mindset on the road

image.altText: Water

items.synopsis: What do you get if you put the defending world champion, defending Olympic champion and current world record holder together in the pool? Arguably one of the most anticipated races of all time.

title.children: Swimming had its Race of the Century two decades ago — but the 400m free at the World Champs will run it close

image.altText: Image of a round ball of red material in a persons hand.

items.synopsis: Australian beekeepers discover the untapped potential of propolis, a sticky substance used by bees as "bee glue" in their hives.

title.children: Beekeepers look to untapped potential of propolis, or 'bee glue', as alternative revenue stream

image.altText: A woman in casual clothes standing on a road on her Blue Mountains property

items.synopsis: NSW fire crews have already responded to more than 800 grass, scrub and bushfires this month. And communities like Susan Alexander's are turning their attention to preparing their properties for the coming summer.

title.children: Susan lost everything in the 2019 NSW fires — she's worried it's going to happen again this year

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu speaks in front of US and Israeli flags

items.synopsis: Israel's prime minister is taken to the hospital for an emergency procedure to implant a pacemaker, plunging the country into deeper turmoil after protests over his contentious judicial overhaul plan.

title.children: Protesters march against Netanyahu's controversial legal overhaul as PM is rushed to hospital

image.altText: A plume of smoke rises over an ammunition depot where explosions occurred at the facility in Kirovsky district in Crimea.

items.synopsis: A Ukrainian drone reportedly hit an ammunition depot in central Crimea, as Russian authorities blame the death of a Russian journalist in Ukraine on cluster munitions.

title.children: Drone hits Crimean ammunition depot as Russia blames journalist death on cluster munition

image.altText: Jamie Foxx smiles while wearing sunglasses courtside at a basketball game

items.synopsis: The Academy Award winning actor, singer and comedian makes his first public comments since being hospitalised for a "medical complication" in April, telling fans he is able to return to work.

title.children: 'I went to hell and back': Jamie Foxx tells fans on Instagram he is recovering from an undisclosed illness

image.altText: A teenaged girl sits on her bed with a wall of photos behind her, wearing beads and ends of hair dyed pink

items.synopsis: Like many teenagers, Ruby was struggling with her mental health. Then, like magic, music and a community of like minds came to the rescue.

title.children: 'Music is my superpower': How singing helped Ruby tackle depression
